column4: i have tries ndiswrapper and it says hardware not found and when i tried to activate propiety drivers the ubunut just stays at the downloading and installing phase, i have to hold power to return to normal.
so i take it my problem has no fix then, linux just isnt ready it seems.
what do see when you try sudo dhclient?
I see no leases in database, sleeping.
sudo ifconfig
btw i have gone through this routine with other users on here when i was connected to the lan.
for ifconfig i see eth0, eth0avahi, lo, wlan0 and wlan0avahi
so you're not getting an ip?
only avahi, lo have inet and ips
hooking up to a router or directly to cable modem?
right now, im not hooked to anything but i did this all before when connected and the result is the same.
if it is a driver problem ...you looked at the broadcom website and no driver?
i have, i downloaded a driver and installed but it doesnt work, lan doesnt work either. i even installed the ndiswrapper and that doesnt do it either.
and there was nothing in dmesg?
apparantly with 9.10 (what i have) propietry drivers are part of the cd and i can activate them, but when i try it just hangs on the downloading stage. Im really lost.
dmesg?
dmesg will output system messages .. so when you try to do something and something isn't working it's a good place to look .. gnu/linux is nothing if not verbose .. :-)
im a beginner :(
we all are ... :-)
yeah.
I disagree on that part ... i like the control ..
i have Dell mini 9 and install Ubuntu Netbook Remix .. worked withtout a problem ...
